intro: Allosandra lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and fragrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its aromatic properties make it valuable in traditional and modern applications. Allosandra lanceolata is also noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitat.
